title: 4-year-old raped, brutalized in northwest Delhi
text:
NEW DELHI: A four-year-old girl was raped and brutalised by her neighbour at a railway colony near Lawrence Road in northwest Delhi on Friday night. A passerby discovered the child in an open plot close to her house with gashes on the body. She raised an alarm and informed the child's family members. She was rushed to a local hospital, where doctors confirmed that she was raped. She was given first-aid and referred to Safdarjung Hospital for further treatment.
The child's family members said that she was last seen around 5pm playing outside her house, and had gone missing since then. A search was launched and the parents were about to inform the police when the passerby discovered their daughter.
Police said the gashes on her body were probably made by a razor, which was found in a nearby bush. They also said that the accused must have been familiar to the child and had lured her to the plot and then brutalised her.
Her father, who works as a mason in the area, also told police that the man had tried to slit her throat but was unsuccessful and fled after injuring her.
A case under sections of POCSO, and under IPC sections 376 (rape) and 307 (attempt to murder) of the has been registered. Police suspect the role of a drug addict in the crime. Locals said a youth from the locality has also been missing since the incident. The child's friends are being interrogated about the circumstances under which she went missing.
Meanwhile, the child underwent a surgery at the hospital and is said to be stable. Police are waiting for her to recuperate after which her statement will be recorded to identify the suspect.
